title: A paire of turtle doves, or, A dainty new Scotch dialogue between a yong-man and his mistresse, both correspondent in affection, &c. To a pretty pleasant tune, called the absence of my mistresse, or I live not where I love.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
publisher: for Thomas Lambert, at the signe of the Hors-shooe in Smithfield,
notes: Verse - "Must the absence of my mistresse".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
